name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - About Devops
description: This section provides an overview of the DevOps organization at Razorpay, which is responsible for ensuring the availability and uptime of Razorpay's services. They manage the cloud infrastructure, implement backup and redundancy measures, and facilitate the deployment of new applications or features. The organization has a flat structure, with members specializing in various components essential for maintaining Razorpay's operations.
use_cases: Ensuring the availability and uptime of Razorpay's services
Managing cloud infrastructure
Implementing backup and redundancy measures
Facilitating the deployment of new applications or features

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Amazon Web Services (AWS)
description: This section discusses Razorpay's use of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as their primary Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) solution. It highlights that Razorpay leverages AWS regions in India to comply with local regulations and provide the best experience for their customers. The section also mentions that Razorpay utilizes various managed services offered by AWS, such as AWS RDS, AWS ElastiCache, AWS Elasticsearch Service, and AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service.
use_cases: Hosting applications and workloads on AWS
Ensuring compliance with local regulations by using AWS regions in India
Providing the best experience for customers by leveraging AWS regions in India
Utilizing managed services like AWS RDS, AWS ElastiCache, AWS Elasticsearch Service, and AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Containers/Docker/Kubernetes
description: This section explains that Razorpay uses containerized applications to enable scalability across different platforms and programming languages. Containerization allows the use of a container orchestration tool like Kubernetes, which is open-source and highly customizable, to manage and deploy these containerized applications efficiently.
use_cases: Scaling applications across different platforms and programming languages
Utilizing an open-source and customizable container orchestration tool (Kubernetes)
Efficient management and deployment of containerized applications

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Observability
description: This section explains the concept of observability, which refers to the ability to understand the internal state of a system based on its external outputs. It highlights three key pillars of observability: logging (tools like EFK, Sumologic), monitoring (tools like Prometheus, Victoria Metrics, Alertmanager), and tracing (tools like OpenTelemetry, Jaeger). These pillars help in gathering and analyzing data from complex applications to gain insights into their behavior and performance.
use_cases: Understanding system behavior
Identifying performance issues
Troubleshooting and debugging
Monitoring application health

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Networking/OS
description: This section discusses the application of networking and Linux system concepts in the DevOps/Infrastructure Engineering team at Razorpay. It explains that Kubernetes, a container orchestration platform, utilizes the existing networking infrastructure provided by AWS (Amazon Web Services) for functionalities like service discovery and communication between containers (pods). Additionally, the team manages custom networking setups required for integrations with banks.
use_cases: Service discovery and inter-pod communication in Kubernetes
Custom networking setups for bank integrations
Managing networking infrastructure on AWS

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Compliance/Security
description: This section discusses the compliance and security measures implemented at Razorpay, a fintech organization. It highlights the need to meet various compliance standards like PCI DSS and SOC2, which require the setup and management of tools for card scanning, file integrity monitoring, logging, and firewalls. Additionally, it mentions that data engineering platforms like Qubole and Looker are allowed on a separate AWS account for processing analytics, with restricted access to data and regular reviews.
use_cases: Meeting compliance standards like PCI DSS and SOC2
Securing financial data and transactions
Monitoring file integrity and logging activities
Processing analytics data on separate platforms with restricted access
capabilities: Restricted data access and regular reviews for analytics platforms

name: DevOps|Infra Engineering at Razorpay.txt - Data Engineering Platform
description: This section discusses the implementation of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) practices at Razorpay. It mentions the use of tools like drone, GitHub Actions, and Spinnaker to establish a formal process for testing and deploying code changes to the production environment. These CI/CD solutions help ensure that code modifications go through necessary checks and validations before being released, promoting a more reliable and streamlined software delivery process.
use_cases: Automated testing of code changes
Streamlined deployment of code to production
Ensuring code quality and reliability
Facilitating collaboration and code integration
capabilities: Integration with tools like drone, GitHub Actions, and Spinnaker
